block.p: Susan Victoria Rowe, the daughter of Ellen McCabe Rowe and William J. Rowe of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday to Philip Enrique Harrison, the son of Montserrat Escofet Harrison and Dale Harrison of Woodlands, Tex. The Rev. Molly McGreevy, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the Indian Harbor Yacht Club.

Mrs. Harrison, 35, is an assistant in the education department at the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York. She is also a painter and printmaker. She graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and studied at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago. Her father is the chairman of Southern Connecticut Newspapers, which publishes The Stamford Advocate and The Greenwich Times. Her mother is an interior designer in Greenwich.

Susan Victoria Rowe, the daughter of Ellen McCabe Rowe and William J. Rowe of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday to Philip Enrique Harrison, the son of Montserrat Escofet Harrison and Dale Harrison of Woodlands, Tex. The Rev. Molly McGreevy, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the Indian Harbor Yacht Club.

Mrs. Harrison, 35, is an assistant in the education department at the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York. She is also a painter and printmaker. She graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and studied at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago. Her father is the chairman of Southern Connecticut Newspapers, which publishes The Stamford Advocate and The Greenwich Times. Her mother is an interior designer in Greenwich.

Mr. Harrison, 29, works in New York as an associate in Latin American research for ING Barings, the Dutch investment bank. He graduated from the University of California at Riverside. His father retired from CARE, the international relief organization, where he was the director for Pakistan.
